workflow.name: Publish Zoom class recordings to Google Classroom automatically
workflow.description:
## About
This flow is ideal for online schools that use Zoom to teach classes and Google Classroom for storing materials and homework.

It listens for Zoom webhooks that come after each recorded call is uploaded to Zoom Cloud (you'll need Zoom paid plan).
When new meeting comes, it filters out calls that last less than 30 mins. 
After duration check, it checks if there is a Google Class that matches the call name. Your call must be named exactly as the Google Class you want the call to be uploaded to. 
If the class is found, it will extract the Class ID. This flow assumes that you have a specific topic used for storing class recordings and materials, so it will look for this topic and upload the material. If topic is not found, you'll get an email.

## Requirements
You'll need a:
- Zoom paid plan that supports Zoom Cloud
- Google cloud console to set up Classroom API and Gmail API
- OpenAI API key or any other provider

conditions.rightValue: zoom call is class recording but class not found.

parameters.content:
## Validate calls by name
Here we check if call name has a match with a Class

## Zoom Webhook Validation
It's a Zoom's initial handshake.

## Form Input
Create a separate form for manual uploads if something fails (e.g. you specified a Class Topic that doesn't exist or your call does not have a correct Class name)

## Check Call Duration
Specify the threshold in the previous node and filter out calls that do not match.

## Find Class & Upload Materials
Here we get the course ID to upload our materials, search for specified topic and actually upload the call to Google Class

## Auto-publish Zoom recordings to Google Classroom

### About
This flow is ideal for online schools that use Zoom to teach classes and Google Classroom for storing materials and homework.

It listens for Zoom webhooks that come after each recorded call is uploaded to Zoom Cloud (you'll need Zoom paid plan).
When new meeting comes, it filters out calls that last less than 30 mins. 
After duration check, it checks if there is a Google Class that matches the call name. Your call must be named exactly as the Google Class you want the call to be uploaded to. 
If the class is found, it will extract the Class ID. This flow assumes that you have a specific topic used for storing class recordings and materials, so it will look for this topic and upload the material. If topic is not found, you'll get an email.

### Setup
- [ ] Set duration threshold and topic name in the "Set Parameters" node.
- [ ] Specify desired name pattern to be generated (currently generates recording date). You can keep it as is and adjust later manually.
- [ ] Register the webhook URL in Zoom and enable recording.completed notifications.
- [ ] Set the HMAC signing secret in the Crypto node to match Zoom.
- [ ] Validate the URL in Zoom (make sure to publish the workflow)
- [ ] Connect Google Classroom (OAuth) and create a connection with the following scopes: 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/classroom.courseworkmaterials
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/classroom.topics.readonly https://www.googleapis.com/auth/classroom.courses.readonly https://www.googleapis.com/auth/classroom.announcements https://www.googleapis.com/auth/classroom.coursework.students
These scopes should be enough but if you get "Not enough scopes" error, just use Claude or ChatGPT to get the required scope and then edit the credential. Put spaces between scopes.
- [ ] Connect a Gmail account for alert emails.
- [ ] Add OpenAI (LangChain) API credentials for the model used to validate names.
- [ ] (Optional) Configure the form webhook for manual upload entries or testing and add a form link to the Gmail node.

### Improve
The last node in the system returns a direct link to the newly created material. You can add a Gmail node to email you that link and easily go and update the material if needed.

values.content: You're a helpuful and intelligent assistant.

=You'll get a zoom call name and current active classes.
Your task description:
the correct scenario is when zoom call contains only class name and this class name has an exact match with one of the given active classes.

Output:
return payload in the following format:

{"status":boolean,"message":""}

with one of messages (MUST BE ONLY ONE FROM BELOW) :
1. "zoom call is not class recording.". set false status.
2. "zoom call is class recording but class not found." set false status.
3. "zoom is class recording and class is found." set true status.

parameters.message: =Topic "2. Class Materials" is not found for {{ $('Find Active Course by Name').item.json.courseName }}
parameters.subject: =Course not found

parameters.message: ={{ $('Check Classes').item.json.output[0].content[0].text.message }}. Upload video manually using this form: {INSERT MANUAL FORM LINK}
parameters.subject: =Course not found

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Crypto node allows you to hash and Hmac string in a specified format and sign a string using a private key. Use this node when you want to encrypt your data.
